4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:24): IETF'ers - if a LC draft has substantial changes, is a new LC draft mandatory? [Based on http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2011JulSep/0601.html , it appears the answer is No]
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:25): alrighty then, please ping me Anne when the SotD reflects those two dates and LC
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:26): oh, so after all that churn, the hybi WG is just going to be dropping the compression stuff anyway?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:27): the minutes at http://www.ietf.org/mail-archive/web/hybi/current/msg08030.html don't actually say anything about that, afaict
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:28): "- Remove deflate-stream from the base spec            --Agreed"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:28): oh, OK
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (16:28): specify the framework in 1 spec and additional layered features in separate specs
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:29): I see
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:29): well, that's what Hixie advocated for from the beginning
